Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: Class "A" six-story 132,570 RSF office building scheduled for January 2022 occupancy. Tenants will enjoy a private lobby & elevator, Magnificent slab heights, Floor-to-ceiling windows, and being close walking distance to all major subway lines and top Harlem restaurants. The landlord will provide Tenant installation.

Common.Strapline.Common.Text: Fantastic Branding Opportunity in Brand New Construction

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: This is a 2-year-old school installation that can be leased to a single user or individual floors. The building is fully renovated, and in move-in condition with high ceilings and great light.

Common.Strapline.Common.Text: Fully renovated building in the heart of Harlem.

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: Conveniently located between Grand Central Terminal and the United Nations headquarters complex in Midtown Manhattan, One Dag is at the crossroads of the business and diplomatic worlds.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: Newly enhanced by more than 20 million dollars in capital improvements, One Dag extends a truly distinct arrival experience.

Common.Strapline.Common.Text: Transformed under the auspices of new owners Rockpoint, and with diverse space options for lease, One Dag is a fitting address for the truly accomplished.

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: In the heart of the Plaza District with great proximity to retail.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: Base building renovations included: consolidating the building core, new elevators, redesigned MEP infrastructure, a new voice, data and cabling infrastructure, new ADA compliant toilets, client and office tenant lobbies, replacing the existing roof and an over-cladding curtain wall with new windows. New retail storefronts were coordinated with the retail architect. 24 hour/7 day access Separate entrance for the United Jewish Federation. Subway entrance at building with direct lines to Manhattan, Queens, and Brooklyn. Close to transportation, banking, and restaurants. State-of-the-art HVAC systems, under direct tenant control. Spacious outdoor terraces with river views.

Common.Strapline.Common.Text: 6,000 RSF in the Plaza District

Common.SpaceDescription.Common.Text: LL to demolish and option to build or offer tenant improvement allowance for new construction

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: On the corner of 59th Street

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: 499 Park is a sleek prism of polished black glass that provides a contemporary counterpoint to the classic residential buildings lining Park Avenue. Located on Park at the corner of 59th Street, the building is on one of New York‚Äôs most desirable corners and is at the center of a prestigious commercial and retail districts. Designed by I.M. Pei to provide a premium office environment to high-end commercial tenants, 499 Park is the newest office building north of 45th Street on Park Avenue and remains the destination for many world-class tenants.

Common.Strapline.Common.Text: Full Floor Opportunities on Prestigious Park Avenue

Common.SpaceDescription.Common.Text:
Built Space
LL will modify or consider re-building

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: 780 Third Avenue is prominently located in Midtown Manhattan's Grand Central District at the intersection of 49th Street and Third Avenue, six blocks from Grand Central Station and three blocks from the United Nations.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
780 Third Avenue is a distinctive architectural accomplishment, soaring forty-eight stories and 570 feet into the east Midtown Manhattan Skyline. The structure is clad in polished Finnish Balmoral granite and is set back from Third Avenue, 48th and 49th Street, to accommodate a large Urban Plaza with twenty-two trees. The entire Plaza is constructed with red Hastings brick and flame-cut rose granite. 

The building has a central core, creating column-free floor plates; giving tenants far greater flexibility in the layout of interiors.

Tenants of 780 Third Avenue will enjoy state-of-the-art amenity floors including conference facilities, work lounge, restaurant, coffee bar and tenant wellness center designed by A+I Architects.

Common.Strapline.Common.Text: The Gardens at 780 Third Avenue ‚Äì Where Modern Businesses Flourish

Common.SpaceDescription.Common.Text: Recently built full floor features 2 conference rooms, 4 offices, 2 phone rooms pantry and open area.
Planned high end prebuilt to feature 2 conference rooms, 2 offices, pantry and open area.
Planned high end prebuilt to feature 3 conference rooms, 4 offices, 2 phone booths, pantry and open area.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
With a large, activated lobby, plentiful outdoor
space and its own newly-renovated pocket park,
685 Third Avenue has greenery, light and air to

provides great connectivity to Grand Central and
features diverse floor plate sizes which cater to a
variety of tenants.

Common.Strapline.Common.Text: The Lights Are Back On At 685 Third

Common.SpaceDescription.Common.Text: Planned high end prebuilt to feature 3 conference  rooms, 4 offices, 2 phone booths, pantry and open area
Planned high-end prebuilt to feature 2 conference rooms, 2 offices, a pantry, and an open area.

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: A short walk to Grand Central and the UN.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: 685 Third Avenue is a Class A, office tower known for its preeminent location and tenant services. The building has undergone a complete renovation to meet the needs of today's corporate tenants. These upgrades include a new facade, lobby and elevators as well as many new building systems such as the HVAC and electrical systems. It is also equipped with the most advanced communications available for both fiber optic and cable connections. One block east of Grand Central Terminal. Heavily trafficked office and retail area with easy access to subway, bus, and MetroNorth transportation lines. Renovation: New lobby, park, elevators, infrastructure.

Common.Strapline.Common.Text: 37,000 RSF in a Class A Office Tower on Third Avenue.

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: Well-positioned location of office space for tenants, and huge foot traffic numbers for retailers. 645 Madison is highly accessible thanks to New York City‚Äôs extensive bus and train network.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: With 24 Hour, 7-day security and concierge, 645 features a renovated lobby with cream travertine marble accented with gray-speckled granite and wood. Tenants will enjoy it's new elevator cabs, closed-circuit television system monitor building entry points.

Common.Strapline.Common.Text: Boutique Space Opportunities at 645 Madison Avenue

Common.SpaceDescription.Common.Text: Built Space. Planned high end prebuilt to feature 2 conference rooms, 4 offices, 2 phone rooms, pantry, and an open area. Great light and views.
Built Space. Landlord will modify/upgrade or consider rebuilding.
Pre-built. Recently upgraded prebuilt features: 8 offices, 2 conference rooms, pantry, and an open area.
Raw Space. Boutique full-floor availability. Landlord will demolish. Nice light and views throughout.
Space is currently built with 1 conference room, 10 offices, pantry, and an open area. Landlord will modify/upgrade. Can also be combined with the adjacent space for the full floor.

Space is currently built with 2 conference rooms, 2 breakout rooms, 13 offices, pantry, and an open area. Landlord will modify/upgrade. Can also be combined with the adjacent space for the full floor.
Space is currently built with XX. Landlord will modify/upgrade or consider rebuilding.

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: 140 East 45th Street is conveniently situated one block from Grand Central Terminal and just three blocks from the United Nations.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: 2GCT is a premier office tower with panoramic views of the New York Skyline and the East River. The building features a two-story lobby with a concierge, state-of-the-art safety and security systems, and an outdoor plaza. The building is accessible twenty-four hours a day, seven days a week, and has a separate freight entrance on East 44th Street.

Common.Strapline.Common.Text: 62,000 RSF in a premier, Midtown office tower

Common.SpaceDescription.Common.Text: Brand new constructed building. Floors to be delivered raw and ready for tenant's construction.f Private entrance for all office tenants on floors 3 - 6 located on 57th Street.
Brand new constructed building.  Floors to be delivered raw and ready for tenant's construction. Private entrance for all office tenants on floors 3 - 6 located on 57th Street.

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: 36 East 57th Street is brilliantly located in the Plaza District, between Park and Madison Avenues, directly across from the Four Seasons Hotel, convenient to the East Side and West Side subway lines, the North, South, and crosstown bus lines, and the chicest restaurants and shopping in New York.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: The new Executive Offices represent the new standard for boutique office space in New York City. The entry features an iconic 93-foot glass totem that reflects the spirit and design of the soaring 96-story residential tower at 432 Park Avenue. The offices are exceptionally spacious, with large column-free spans, flexible floor plates, and ceiling heights of more than fifteen feet. Uninterrupted floor-to-ceiling windows allow an abundance of natural light to illuminate each space. Strong, expansive, and sleek, the floors offer the highest-quality office space for the most demanding tenants.

Common.SpaceDescription.Common.Text:
High-end details throughout, full-height glass doors and office fronts, bronze hardware, open style pantry with state-of-the-art appliances.
Term: 4 to 7 years

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: 535 Madison Avenue is in the Fifth/Madison Avenue submarket on the northeast corner of 54th Street and Madison Avenue.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: 535 Madison Avenue is a bold, prism-shaped office tower that asserts itself vigorously on the Manhattan skyline.  Designed by award-winning architect Edward Larrabee Barnes, this minimalist building has silvery-gray aluminum panels and blue-green windows.  Its broad, covered entrance plaza faces a landscaped mid block park with sculptured waterfalls, seating areas and 30-foot trees.  The building has multi-levels of retail and is convenient to all public transportation.

Common.Strapline.Common.Text: 535 Madison Avenue  - One Unit Remains

Common.SpaceDescription.Common.Text: High-end installation featuring 5 glass fronted offices, 1 conference room, 2 large workstations and kitchen/pantry. Fully furnished with amazing views throughout the space.

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: Located just blocks away from Central Park, Bloomingdales, and The Plaza Hotel.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: Constructed of gray limestone, pearl gray mariposa marble, black cambian granite, and bronze, this 53 story tower offers 24/7 access and state-of-the-art security systems. The office entrance is on West 56th Street.

Common.Strapline.Common.Text: Entire High-Rise Floor Available in Midtown Plaza,

Common.SpaceDescription.Common.Text: Full floor available in a boutique corner office building.  Landlord will build to suit.  Multiple divisions of the floor are available.  Windows all around. Ideal for any Office/Medical use.  The sample division shows a split of 3,413 sf and 1,535 sf.

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: 335 Madison Avenue is located in the Grand Central submarket between 43rd Street and 44th Street. Building offers direct access to Grand Central Station, bus, and subway lines.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: 335 Madison Avenue‚Äôs redevelopment is fully underway and will feature a brand new entrance and lobby along with 150,000 SF of amenity space, creating Manhattan‚Äôs first vertical innovation campus. Building amenities allow for improved space efficiency for tenants and will include a coffee shop, retail cooperative, bar, marketplace, amphitheater, cafeteria, terrace and gym & wellness center.

Common.Strapline.Common.Text: The 28-story building contains 1,046,984 sf of office space. Tenant and visitor check in at concierge desk provides maximum security.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: Close to Bryant Park and Grand Central Station

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: Designed by New York architects Cook + Fox, 360 Madison Avenue is a peaceful retreat in the heart of Midtown, located on Madison Avenue and 45th Street. The clear glass structure reflects the drama and cleanliness of its design and the dynamic neighborhood surrounding it. Sleek and transparent, the new building will create a visual relief to the density of its neighborhood. A dramatic multi-story entrance, set back from the street, welcomes you to the building, where a unique lobby will provide a peaceful escape from the bustling activity of Midtown.

Common.Strapline.Common.Text: Contiguous Floors, Midtown Convenience & Reputable Ownership

Common.SpaceDescription.Common.Text:
2nd generation unit built with 6 offices, 1 large board room, and pantry
Potential to lease the entire floor of 17,724 sf on a long-term basis

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: Close to Rockefeller Center Center, Bryant Park and the New York Public Library.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: Located midway between Grand Central Terminal and Rockefeller Center, 565 Fifth Avenue is an architectural icon, designed by Emery Roth & Sons in collaboration with Norman Jaffe. Its graduated glass fa√ßade rises 30 stories above one of Manhattan‚Äôs most prestigious blocks, revealing expansive views of Fifth Avenue and Midtown. Outside, the building's architecture creates an elegant crystalline effect; Inside, rich marbles and woods from around the world and brushed stainless steel trim and detailing serve to enhance the quality of the environment.

Common.Strapline.Common.Text: 30 story high, clear glass facade.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
Newly constructed and furnished block of up to
89,881 RSF in the heart of Rockefeller Center.
Tenants will have access to an exclusive and expansive outdoor terrace on the 10th floor.
Ability to lease the entire footprint or on a floor-by-floor basis

Common.SpaceDescription.Common.Text:
Efficient layout: 16-seat conference room, two 8-seat conference rooms, three private offices, two large team rooms (12 persons and 8 persons), open space for more than 24 people, furniture available, supplemental air conditioning.
Sublease through June 30, 2021

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: Steps away from Columbus Circle and Central Park. Easy access to the N,Q,R,W, and F trains.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: Major building renovation in the works to include: lobby improvment and remodeling, upgraded elevator cabs, and new security/fire safety systems.

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: Between 45th Street and 46th Street

Common.Strapline.Common.Text: Last Two 6,000 RSF Full Floors Remaining

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: The building stands at the key intersection of Park Avenue South and 32nd Street and is convenient to all major transportation.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: The office tower made of brick, glass, and dark metal has been recently remodeled. The building has a new marble lobby with concierge, a new cooling tower, and a new HVAC system. The elevators and restrooms were also recently renovated. Other amenities include an outdoor, public plaza, and a 150-car parking garage.

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: Excellent location on Fifth Avenue and the corner of 45th Street, with great proximity to Grand Central Terminal, shopping, restaurants, hotels, 44th Street's "Club Row" and Bryant Park.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: Modern boutique office building. Lobby renovation recently completed.

Common.Strapline.Common.Text: Penthouse Full Floor Opportunity

Common.SpaceDescription.Common.Text: Landlord is building the 2nd Floor with an open and collaborative feel. Expected completion end of Q1 2020.
-Landlord has finished a high end white-box of the floor and will provide concessions for an incoming tenant.

- Creative installation in which landlord can modify.
- Can be combined with the Entire 15th Floor.
- Entire 14th Floor comes with an exclusive rooftop terrace.

- Landlord in the process of completing a ‚Äúwhite-box‚Äù of the 15th floor. Landlord can turnkey or provide market concessions

Built with 8 offices, 2 conference rooms, pantry, and an open area for 50+.  Corner unit with abundant natural light and views. Plug and play, fully furnished and wired.

Common.Highlight.Common.Text: A new lobby by leading NYC interior design firm Studios Architecture incorporates a striking insulated glass fa√ßade, along with a stone feature wall and complementary design notes throughout. Additional enhancements include building and systems upgrades such as elevator modernization, roof renewal, updates to tenant spaces and Energy Star status.

Further enhancing its sweeping updates, 470 Park Avenue South is newly appointed with a number of exclusive amenities that only intensify its appeal. A ground-floor cafe, upscale espresso bar and open-air fire pit provide purposeful places to meet, greet and unwind.

The Rooftop Terrace is a private natureframed outdoor space featuring a bar and fire pit, and incredible skyline views. The Terrace is a great space to unwind after work, host an event, or network with colleagues. This space can be crafted to meet your company‚Äôs needs and specs.
Encompassing more than 300,000 RSF across two historic buildings, 470 Park Avenue South provides ample opportunity for innovative companies to shape their spaces to their individual needs.
Efficient 10,000 SF boutique floor plates with dramatic views and convenient access to green spaces, transit and local amenities raise the bar on working.

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
At the heart of entrepreneurial Silicon Alley, 470 Park Avenue South is at the
center of it all. Madison Park, boutique residential and hotel options and
countless conveniences all support a thriving local community. Just steps
away, Grand Central Terminal, Penn Station, the 33rd Street subway, the
PATH and multiple bus lines bring the city within reach.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: 470 Park Avenue South is a building refocused, redesigned and reimagined for tomorrow. Here historical charm and modern amenity come together to create an environment where standards are elevated. Centrally positioned in booming Midtown South and with views of Grand Central and the Chrysler Building, it embraces what‚Äôs next while keeping the spirit of old New York burning. A place of constant renaissance, 470 Park Avenue South is for those with uncompromisingly high expectations.

Common.Strapline.Common.Text: Best Built Space in Midtown South

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: Conviently located close to Port Authority and Penn Station.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: 461 Fifth Avenue is a quintessential Fifth Avenue building. The 10-story base evokes the articulated stone style of surrounding buildings, while above it a sleek 18-story tower becomes a shaft of gently curving glass supported by handsome corner piers. A peaked copper mansard roof with a dramatic lighting scheme crowns the building. The freight entrance is located on East 40th Street and the building is accessible 24 hours a day, 7 days a week.

Common.SpaceDescription.Common.Text:
This owner-occupied asset will be undergoing a FULL BUILDING RENOVATION and both Office and Lab/Life Science users will be considered. Floors shall be delivered demolished with new building systems and a full concession package. 

For those needing Lab/Life Science, Ownership will deliver lab-ready shell space inclusive of all lab support rooms, HVAC, plumbing, and electrical infrastructure upgrades, gas connections, and fume hoods. The building has 4 sides of light with expansive views north and south over Park Avenue South. Engineering report detailing infrastructure upgrades necessary to support laboratory use is available upon request. 

Upon completion of construction, the building will also feature a unique commercially available, rent-by-the-bench Lab facility. Pricing upon request.

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: The building is in close proximity to Madison Square Park and the Lexington Avenue subway.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: 345 Park Avenue South features retail space on the ground. Loft-style floors, and feature 13- to 20-feet ceiling heights. The property also includes an 8,000-square-foot private roof terrace and a penthouse with a skylight.

Common.Strapline.Common.Text: Close to 200,000 RSF of demolished floors with new building systems and a full concession package.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: Hovering 32 stories above Bryant Park, this unique two floor Penthouse offers sprawling views of the Empire State Building and Manhattan skyline. Finished in 2019, the buildout features a large executive office, conference room, and an open area for 15. Furniture can be made available, and private restrooms are exclusive to the incoming tenant. Located between Fifth & Sixth Avenues, 11 W 42nd is directly across the street from Bryant Park with lobby access on both 42nd & 43rd Streets only steps from the BDFM7 trains.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: Pier 17 is being reclaimed for New Yorkers via dynamic food, drink, art, architecture, retail, and entertainment concepts that foster community and engage the city‚Äôs denizens, year-round. Pier 17 and the surrounding Seaport District come out of their tourist trap shadows as its new tenants incorporate the neighborhood‚Äôs rich past while embracing its future as a port of discovery.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
32 Old Slip is Downtown's most sophisticated new business environment. It has been designed to anticipate all the high-tech demands of today and tomorrow, with many features simply unavailable at competing properties. The result being high-capacity, high-flexibility facilities for the modern tenant.

32 Old Slip is surrounded by landscaped plazas and welcomes tenants and visitors with a 40-foot granite and marble lobby. The stone facade of the building's base was designed to complement the masonry of the original 1st Precinct Station House adjacent to the building. Just steps from any Financial District appointment, 32 Old Slip  is also convenient to all ground, air, water and underground transportation. 

Building-wide design features include:
¬∑ Capital improvements underway
¬∑ New elevator cabs
¬∑ New lobby
¬∑ Sufficient generator capacity


This building has been Wired Certified Gold. Wired Certified Gold means a building provides tenants with access to multiple high-quality internet service providers and a variety of cabling types including fiber. The infrastructure measures in place ensure connectivity sources are protected, redundant, and prepared for connectivity needs of future tenants as well. 

Internet Service Providers available: Cogent-Fiber, Lightower-Fiber, RCN-Fiber, Verizon-Fiber, Level 3-Fiber, Time Warner Cable-Coaxial, AT&T-Fiber, Verizon-Copper


Since 2014 this has been a leasehold interest. See CoStar property ID 9603225 and related sales comp for the underlying leased fee interest.

Broad Financial Center Partners LLP, a Kipp-Stawski company, purchased the building from First Pac Ltd. for $108.81 million. Both parties represented themselves.

The impressive, pale-blue, mirrored office tower that is Broad Financial Center occupies almost an entire block in one of the Financial District's premier locations.  The Wall Street BMT subway is at the front door.  The IRT subway, the Staten Island Ferry and Downtown Heliports are steps away.  PATH transit is within convenient walking distance.  Above ground transportation includes express bus service to Midtown, Brooklyn, Queens and Staten Island.

Common.Strapline.Common.Text: Built Tower Floors

Common.SpaceDescription.Common.Text:
Premises can be divided into two
separate suites of 17,730 RSF and
7,491 RSF.  Recently built plug-n-play installation with windows on 3 sides. Creative open tech space with exposed ceilings. Furniture can be made available. The landlord is willing to provide a Direct Extension through 10/31/27. Great Hudson River Views.  A block from the Hudson River, Pier 40, Pier 45, and waterfront parks.

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: Located in the Hudson Square/TriBeCa submarket, 95 Morton Street is close to excellent shopping and restaurants in the Village and SoHo.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: Built in 1911 and renovated from an expansive factory, 95 Morton Street features soaring ceiling heights, oversized windows with river views, a newly renovated lobby with 24 hour access and fiber optic voice and data capabilities. A state-of-the-art elevator and HVAC upgrade is also in progress. 95 Morton Street is located in the West Village, a short walk from the 1 and 9 subway and two blocks from the PATH train.

Common.Strapline.Common.Text: New and Unique Tower Floor Sublease Opportunity

Common.SpaceDescription.Common.Text: Brand New Trophy Development. Recently built space with an expansive outdoor terrace.
Brand New Development. Ready for tenant occupancy. Floor-to-Ceiling Windows.
Brand New Development. Last remaining Pre-built. Ready for tenant occupancy. Floor-to-Ceiling Windows.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: Unparalleled physical attributes including exceptional light, air, and views, soaring ceilings, and efficient floor plates.

Common.Strapline.Common.Text: Nearly 27,000 RSF of brand new, pre-built space.
